metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6167 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: Mozilla Firefox through 27 sends HTTP Cookie headers without first validating that they have the required character-set restrictions, which allows remote attackers to conduct the equivalent of a persistent Logout CSRF attack via a crafted parameter that forces a web application to set a malformed cookie within an HTTP response.

notes.Note: chrisccoulson> The upstream Mozilla bug is marked as wontfix. This only affects cookies set via document.cookie (A similar issue for cookies set via the HTTP Set-Cookie header was fixed in CVE-2016-1939)

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
